module.description: Deployment binding the apache server and the test client node(s).
module.name: examples/tutorials/service-testing/system

image.description: Apache web server appliance with custom landing page.
image.name: examples/tutorials/service-testing/apache

targetExpanded.name: execute

image.description: Web client tests server connectivity and verifies content.
image.name: examples/tutorials/service-testing/client

targets.target:
#!/bin/sh -xe # Wait for the metadata to be resolved web_server_ip=$(ss-get --timeout 360 webserver.hostname) web_server_port=$(ss-get --timeout 360 webserver.port) ss-get --timeout 360 webserver.ready
# Execute the test ENDPOINT=http://${web_server_ip}:${web_server_port}/data.txt wget -t 2 -O /tmp/data.txt ${ENDPOINT} [ "$?" = "0" ] & ss-set statecustom "OK: $(cat /tmp/data.txt)" || ss-abort "Could not get the test file: ${ENDPOINT}"

targetExpanded.name: execute
targetExpanded.subTarget:
#!/bin/sh -xe # Wait for the metadata to be resolved web_server_ip=$(ss-get --timeout 360 webserver.hostname) web_server_port=$(ss-get --timeout 360 webserver.port) ss-get --timeout 360 webserver.ready
# Execute the test ENDPOINT=http://${web_server_ip}:${web_server_port}/data.txt wget -t 2 -O /tmp/data.txt ${ENDPOINT} [ "$?" = "0" ] & ss-set statecustom "OK: $(cat /tmp/data.txt)" || ss-abort "Could not get the test file: ${ENDPOINT}"

parameter.name: webserver.port
parameter.description: Port on which the web server listens

parameter.name: testclient:node.increment
parameter.description: Current increment value for node instances ids

parameter.name: General.On Error Run Forever
parameter.description: If an error occurs, keep the execution running for investigation.

parameter.name: garbage_collected
parameter.description: true if the Run was already garbage collected

parameter.name: apache:node.increment
parameter.description: Current increment value for node instances ids

parameter.name: General.On Success Run Forever
parameter.description: If no errors occur, keep the execution running. Useful for deployment or long tests.
